data.description: The allocation of economic and social rewards in the United States; emphasis on persistently poor regions and communities; analysis of selected minority groups and their poverty statuses; poverty programs and their consequences for structural and cultural changes.
data.title: POVERTY AND PLACE

data.description: Sociological examination of the linkages between the social and biophysical dimensions of the environment. Key topics include community organizing, local food systems, energy transitions, environmental justice, resource dependence, and sustainable development.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO COMMUNITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SOCIOLOGY
